Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän?
I see them.
Get ready for action!
@BATTLE
Another victory. Good work.
Are you--
What the...?
Something the matter, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: I think I was just snubbed by U-37.

Fields.DialogueText: I tried to talk to her after the combat, but she walked away from me in a huff.
Are you sure? That doesn't sound like her.
What are you saying?
U-37 is a Walküre who appreciates straightforwardness.
She always follows orders. If you have a concern, why don't you just request her presence?
Fair enough. Maybe I was making this whole situation more difficult than it needed to be.
You didn't hear it from me, Kapitän.
Very funny, Bethke.

Fields.MenuText: U-37 seems really shy.
I think U-37 has a hearing problem.

Fields.DialogueText: She isn't timid, exactly. I'd say she's a bit... haughty. Maybe she didn't realize you had something to say?
Perhaps there was a misunderstanding. She may not have realized you had something to tell her.
Ahem!
Requesting the presence of U-37. Please report to your captain.
There you are.
... Reporting as ordered, Kapitän.
I'd like to talk if you have a moment. I just wanted to get a better idea of what kind of Belle you are.
Das ist fair. I've been sizing you up as well, Kapitän.
Oh? What do you think?
I've nothing awe-inspiring to report thus far. But you haven't disappointed me either.

Fields.MenuText: You certainly speak your mind, don't you?
I suppose that's fair.
How rude.

Fields.DialogueText: I have no time for games, Kapitän. That is, unless we're playing actually playing a card game.
I'm a tough critic, Kapitän. You should take pride in the fact that I find your performance satisfactory.
Bah. Learn to take a compliment.
And what about you? Have you gleaned any useful information about me?

Fields.MenuText: You're quite... candid.
I already think you're a bit rowdy.
It's too soon to say.

Fields.DialogueText: Couldn't think of any nicer words, eh, Kapitän? It's all right, I'm used to it.
Aw. You hurt my feelings.
Don't think too hard. People are often exactly as they seem.
Well... your responses are already making me reassess my impressions of you.
I hope that's a good thing.
Hmm... I have to go, Kapitän. I spy a few Nixen I'd like to sink.
You know I should accompany you for things like that, right?
Quit dawdling, then. Come on.
@BATTLE
That was a compliment?
Pull that stick out, Kapitän.
Oh. I didn't mean to--
I'm just fooling, Kapitän.
Really?
Nein. You can't hear the deadpan tone in my voice?
That's not very good advice...
Are you certain?
Ah, U-37. I was hoping I would bump into you.
Ja? Why would you?

Fields.MenuText: Fine, it was a lie. I just wanted to say something nice.
Excuse me? I thought we were on good terms.
Because you really rejuvenate my spirits.

Fields.DialogueText: Your pleasantries need work!
Don't overreact, Princess. Lighten up.
You making fun of me?
What?
Are you hard of hearing? Or just easily confused?

Fields.MenuText: I'm deaf.
I think it must be that second one.
I'm still your commanding officer, you know.

Fields.DialogueText: Get the wax out of your ears!
That's all right. All you have to do is follow my lead.
Kapitän, I respectfully request your cooperation.
We have work to do!
What's your issue, U-37?
I've detected a handful of Nixen in the vicinity.
How? We haven't had any indication that there are any enemies nearby.
They aren't that close, but I can feel their disruptions in the water reverberate through me.
I can look up, gaze across the surface of the ocean, and see everything.
Right. That's a handy skill to have.
So, it sounds like we have some Morganas to take care of.
Let's scare them off!
Fine by me.
@BATTLE
Lead in what?
What are you doing here? What do you want?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing, actually.
I would think it would be fairly obvious.
I could ask the same of you.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know if you should admit that to your subordinates.
Someone's touchy.
I'm making myself useful.
Can't handle the heat? I'm holding my tongue for you, Kapitän.
It's fine. I'm adjusting to your provocative façade.
That implies that it isn't real.
Well, I wouldn't know. I only know the face I'm shown.
Fair enough.
Are there more sides to you? Is there a different U-37 you want to show me?
Will you stop with those kinds of sappy questions? I don't know anything about that.
I'll learn to better understand you. Eventually.
Suit yourself.
What activities do you enjoy? In your free time, I mean.
Nixen.
I specified your free time, U-37.
Nixen!
Are you not listening?
Are you!? Give some orders! We're about to see a little chaos.
Oh. Damn.
@BATTLE
Even the commanding officer has some time off.
Kapitän.
My, what a surprise.
Save it.
Are you here to finally tell me more about yourself?
What the hell are you talking about?
I'm still trying to make small talk with you.
Wofür? What's the point?

Fields.MenuText: I want to keep up your morale.
I want to increase our coordination.
I just want to.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't patronize me. I'm more motivated than anyone.
Well, I understand that desire. But the crew already performs well together, as is.
Oh. Ja, well... fair enough.
All right.
Anyway, there isn't much to know about me.
Nonsense! I'm sure you're quite the multi-faceted individual.
... I don't think so.
Answer my question. What do you like to do?
Is that an order?
No. I want you to want to chat with me.
Nixen.
Now? I didn't hear the alarm.
No, I mean taking down Nixen is now my main passion.
So that's what you meant? Although it's good to hear, I don't think that counts as an interest.
Then how about... keeping watch? Does that count as a hobby?
Heh.
Was ist es? Am I being funny?
No. You're being serious. And that's what's funny.
@BATTLE
Raid! The Morganas are raiding us! Get to your stations!
@BATTLE
U-37, are you there?
She's on watch again, Kapitän.
I told her to rest. She's been at it for quite a while.
Do you think she doesn't have faith in us?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, basically. We're going to have to keep earning her trust.
I think she's just restless.
She has her own way of showing she cares.

Fields.DialogueText: Damn. Is that right?
Are you sure?
Are you sure?
That's what I believe.
Well, you're normally a good judge of character, I suppose.
She may be rough around the edges, but she's a good person.
I wonder if that's an odd thing to say about any Walküren of the Fleet.
I mean it.
Have you ever noticed how much of a gentlewoman she is on the battlefield?
Ja, Kapitän.
She is always respectful of her opponents, even if they aren't deserving of such respect.
Still, she's pushing herself. I know it.
And I'm afraid things won't end well for her if she pushes herself too far.
Then you'll have to do something, won't you?
Yes, Lieutenant. I will.
Admiral Cutter! Are you seeing us off?
Yes, Captain. I hope you return with good news.
Oh, and send my regards to U-37.
I will. It was a good visit.
Is he gone?
There you are! A bit unprofessional for you to avoid seeing the Admiral off the ship. Why were you hiding?
I wasn't!
Do you have an issue with Admiral Cutter?
The opposite, really. I very much admire the Admiral.
Then you should have spoken up.
I would like to earn his respect before meeting him.

Fields.MenuText: That's a surprise. You're the last person I'd expect to have an inferiority complex.

Fields.DialogueText: I have a lot of... room for improvement.
Not just on the battlefield, either.
That's oddly self-aware of you.
Lass uns gehen. We have something to prove out there.
With what? Are there enemies headed in our direction?
Nein. But there are Morganas heading toward a few shipping vessels a few miles out, and I think we could intercept them before they have the chance to endanger those ships.
Good thinking. Let's do it.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Respect goes both ways.
You won't earn it by avoiding him.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not ready yet.
I was not trying to disrespect our guest, Kapitän.
Excited? I think I can feel the hull shaking.
Ja, actually. I've been looking forward to doing this.
Well, we'll have to make sure we're in safe waters, first.
We aren't. I can sense it in the water. There are Morganas nearby.
Then let's see to them.
Jawohl!
@BATTLE
Attention, crew - a meeting will be held on deck in two minutes. Attendance is mandatory.
Kapitän? What's the ruckus all about?
See for yourself.
*whistle* Look at this luxurious spread!
U-37 ordered it for the crew. She wanted to celebrate her beloved comrades.
She said that?
I inferred it. She also bought similar spreads for other ships in the fleet.
She's loaded, eh? I can't believe she was able to afford all of this.

Fields.MenuText: I was more surprised by her generosity.
Maybe she doesn't have much other use for money.
Yes. She's quite the provider.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not complaining!
I'm not complaining!
I'm not complaining!
I'm going to dig in. Don't mind me, Kapitän.
Heh. Same here.
*burp!*
Greetings to you, too, Kapitän.
You really throw quite the banquet, don't you?
I wanted to validate our crew, and make them feel like their hopes and lives are worth something.
Noble of you, U-37. I'm sure the crew appreciated the gesture...
... but I don't think you can buy loyalty.
Das ist okay.
I only wanted to buy them some happiness.
They really do deserve all the praise. I couldn't do my job without them.

Fields.MenuText: Huh. Normally you avoid sentiment, U-37.
I agree. We're nothing without our crew.
I disagree. You deserve your fair share of credit.

Fields.DialogueText: Everyone has the need to show genuine affection. Sometimes.
That's kind of you to say, Kapitän.
I value you, too, Kapitän.
Really? This is so... unusual for you. Are you feeling alright?
Entschuldigung, Kapitän. I need to lean against something.
Ah. I see it now. You've had a little too much to drink!
Certainly makes you more honest, U-37.
More honest about hurting you!
Oh, dear.
And I don't get... drunk, you... punk!
Fie on you. You outlaw!
I should... get some air...
Heh. What the hell?
@BATTLE
U-37, how are you feeling?
I'm... as good as they come.

Fields.MenuText: I just wanted to check up on you.
You said some pretty purposeful things while you were drunk.

Fields.DialogueText: Why would you want to do that?
I wasn't drunk!
I think I should be trying harder to support you, emotionally.
Was? Emotionally?! Why would you think that?
I worry about you.
Why be concerned? Es geht mir gut. I'm fine.
I think, on the inside, this war is putting a lot of pressure and stress on your shoulders.
You push yourself, for the sake of everyone else.
This is ridiculous.
And you're guarded. You're not really investing in others emotionally.
U-37. I don't think you can be happy that way.
Who made you Sigmund Freud?
I just want to be your friend. You can rely on me.
... Fine! All right?
I... might try relying on you. From time to time. Okay?
That's great!
Kapitän. I have something to confide in you.
Already? What is it?
*ALARM*
Mention that sooner!
I didn't want to interrupt you. You sounded so serious, heh.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I've been thinking about what you said.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you just ignoring me?
Hallo, Kapitän.
Greetings, U-37.
I... I've been thinking about the things you've been saying.
And I don't completely agree. But I don't completely disagree either...
What are you saying?
I'm going to use you as a confessional booth, of sorts. In the hopes that sharing my thoughts and feelings might take some of the pressure off me.

Fields.MenuText: You really think that might work?

Fields.DialogueText: Come on, I'm counting on you. Instill a little confidence in me, Kapitän!
Uh. Well, all right.
So what's on your mind?
I was thinking about... what it means for me to succeed. And my goals for the future.
My sisters and I were made to fight. And fight well.
How many sisters do you have?
Thirty-seven.
Really!?
No. Seven.
Why...
I'm one of the eight Type-IX German submarines.
Of all my sisters, I am the deadliest.
You're not afraid to speak highly of yourself, are you?
You're not being a very good confessional, Kapitän.
U-37, what do you really want?
I want to be successful, and live up to the expectations of my creators and my homeland.
And one day... I want a warrior's death.
Oh...
*ALARM*
But not today!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: No need to feel strange about it. That's what I'm here for.
*Say nothing and let her keep talking*

Fields.DialogueText: I came to the same conclusion, Kapitän.
Ah... I'll just presume from your silence that you agree with my plan.
Lieutenant Bethke, how goes it?
Slow and steady, Kapitän.
Good. Have you seen U-37?
I believe she's in her chambers, Kapitän.
All right. Dismissed.
Wait... do I hear... music?

Fields.MenuText: *Let yourself into U-37's room*
*Knock softly*
*Give up*

Fields.DialogueText: No response? Maybe she's not in...
... No, I can't be a chicken.
U-37, I'm coming in!
*BONK*
Ooops!
Ow...
Sorry! I hit you in the face with that door, didn't I?
I probably should have seen it coming.
You're not upset?
I've endured worse hits, Kapitän.
So... where's that music coming from?
My plattenspieler. I... the turntable case is from Ebner, but the workings are... never mind. It doesn't matter.
Can I see it?
Nein! Sorry. It's... it's my most prized possession. I'm very protective of it.
Oh. Er... that's fine. So, you enjoy listening to music? Any genre in particular?
We have company, Kapitän.
*ALARM*
Let's get moving, then.
@BATTLE
Kapitän?
Yes? Yes, what is it?
... Kapitän, you're acting very strangely.

Fields.MenuText: No, I'm not!

Fields.DialogueText: I... I just want to apologize again for barging into your room and hitting you in the face with the door.
Oh. This again.
You have enough on your plate with the Morganas out for you. You shouldn't have to worry about being injured by me as well.
Mach dir keine Sorgen. It's not a big deal.
Are you sure? I mean, I invaded your privacy too.
If you continue to press the matter, it might become a big deal. But right now, das macht mir nichts.
Whew. All right, then...
Goodness, you're so easily worked up.
I worry about you, that's all.
That's... kind of you to say, Kapitän. Now that's behind us, we need to get ready for a fight!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I could say the same thing about you.
Give me a chance to explain...

Fields.DialogueText: See? Even your defensiveness about acting strange is... strange.
Is that so? Let's focus on you right now.
Gladly, Kapitän.
Captain!
It's... you. Every ship seems to have one of you.
Don't be that way, Captain! I'm your best guy for odd jobs!
I won't deny your usefulness, but I don't always condone your methods...
Well, that can't be helped.
Need anything?

Fields.MenuText: No, actually.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm good at reading people. I think that look on your face says otherwise.
Kapitän.
Who's this sleaze?
It's Rivers, ma'am. Seaman Rivers. Not a sleaze.
You're not very nice, are you?
What an odd man.
You've got that right. Did you need something?
I wanted to prepare the ship, because--
*ALARM*
... because the Nixen are on their way.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I need you to just... not be so shady. Can you clean up a little bit?
I need to know how you got out of the brig.

Fields.DialogueText: What are you talking about? I just got a haircut yesterday.
Gotta catch me first, Captain! Just kidding...
Nixen in sight!
Morganas? Roger, U-37. Let's make a cautious approach.
They never see me coming, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
You're quite the fighter, U-37.
If I might be permitted to say so, you're pretty reliable yourself, Kapitän.
You're permitted. I don't know if you've noticed, but we don't really require strict formality in this crew.
I don't really think much about it. The formal just comes naturally to me.
I can tell.
If anything, you're the one whose speech is too stiff when you call me.

Fields.MenuText: True, U-37 is a mouthful.

Fields.DialogueText: Actually, that's... not what I was referring to at all!
I meant you're all business with me.
My first impression of you was more... dour.
I am serious when the times are serious, Kappi!
Oh, I can really see that... Uzi.
Uzi? UZI?!
That's...
Actually, ich hasse es nicht. It's not a terrible nickname.
You like it?
It's acceptable!
Let's go, Uzi.
Ja!

Fields.MenuText: You're sillier than I thought.
My regrets. May I issue a formal apology to you?

Fields.DialogueText: What do you mean by that?
You've got a dry sense of humor, don't you? Maybe we're more alike than I thought.
"Kappi?"
I'm experimenting with alternatives to strict formality.
You lazing around, Kapitän?
What's it to you?
I'm feeling a little antsy. Want to play some cards?
You always carry a deck of cards with you, don't you? Sure, what do you play?
I play everything. Pick a card game. And if I haven't heard of it, I demand you teach it to me!

Fields.MenuText: Have you ever played gin rummy?
Do you know how to play spades?
Shall I take you down in a game of strip poker?

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, I excel at gin! Let's play!
Ja, I'm familiar with it. We'll need two members of the crew to join us, though.
I don't back down from a challenge! How is it played?
Well, to start...
*ALARM*
Hear that?
It's another challenger at our door.
They don't know what's coming for them.
@BATTLE
*coughs* Really?!
*ALARM*
And just when I was moments away from beating you.
You wish. C'mon, let's see to these Morganas.
@BATTLE
You're becoming even more skilled, Uzi.
Don't get sentimental on me now, Kap.

Fields.MenuText: I'll get as sentimental as I damn well please.
Heh. My apologies.
Whatever.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, all right then.
Princess.
That's the right answer.
Come on, now's a good time to tell me what you're thinking about.
... Do I have to?
I'd say so.
Die Wahrheit ist... I see qualities, in you and in the crew, that I wish I was better at expressing.
I just don't have the emotional capacity to open up to others that many seem to have.
That's so... genuine and honest of you, Uzi.
Ha! You think I was being serious, Kapitän?
That sounded serious to me...
That's quite a play. Nice move...
Hey there, Captain!
Seaman Rivers. Is something the matter?
I should be asking you that. You look like an absolute crumb right now.
And your tone sounds like a grifter's.
Heh.
Do you need help with anything?
I'm fine.
Ah. It's love troubles, right? It totally is! Am I right? Am I right?

Fields.MenuText: Not exactly.
I really ought to have you transferred.
Yes. Not that it's any of your business.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, boo. Explain yourself.
That won't ever happen. You know I'm useful.
Well, that's all I wanted from you.
Just get out of here.
Heh. That's fine. No problem.
Uzi, did you overhear that conversation?
What? Nein. Sorry, I'm a little distracted.
Distracted, you say? What is it?
Well...
*ALARM*
Mist! I didn't see them coming!
It's all right. We'll be ready for them!
Let's go!
@BATTLE
Achtung, crew! We're having another banquet in the mess!
Get ready to chow down!
It must be my lucky day!
Pace yourself. We don't want another incident.
All right, all right. I get it.
I didn't know you two were friends, Uzi.
We aren't.
Oh.
We had dinner. Once.
O-Oh! I had no idea you had a history.
Hah! Not much of one. He couldn't handle me.
Look at this decadent display! Who could pass this up?
What's with your face, Captain? You look like you've seen a ghost.
Carry on, Seaman Rivers.
No complaints here!
Well, I'm glad everyone seems to be enjoying our little feast.
You really brighten up when you provide for others.
You're getting too sentimental, Kapitän. You know that ruins my mood.
Heh. I know.
It's too bad Admiral Cutter couldn't make it.
It's... it's fine. You'll be here, right?

Fields.MenuText: Of course.
I'm staying for the food.
I have to go.

Fields.DialogueText: Good.
That's perfectly fine too!
Kapitän! You ass!
Uh oh! We've got an interruption...
@BATTLE
Nixen in the water! A lot of them.
Range?
We've only got a few seconds before they come over the horizon, Kapitän.
Dammit. How did they spot us?
Look! They're visible now.
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: Steady as she goes, U-37.

Fields.DialogueText: No more time to prepare. Let's go!
Jawohl!
I won't let anything happen to you!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: If you have a battle cry, now's the time.
A little more warning would have been nice, U-37.

Fields.DialogueText: Always so calm, Kapitän... but this is the exciting part!
A battle cry? Why haven't I thought of that before?!
I warned you as soon as I detected the enemy, Kapitän.
What in blazes...
What are you doing!?
Was? I'm only standing watch.
Again!? Still!? Euthie, you look really tired...
I'll take that as a compliment to my work ethic.
When was the last time you slept?
I don't need sleep.
You're going to hurt yourself.
Are you ordering me to stand down?
No. But I am a little concerned.
Oh, bah.

Fields.MenuText: Your impertinence will one day endanger the loyalty and respect you've garnered.
Your arrogance will eventually get you killed.
Your zeal will one day pull you into an unwinnable circumstance.

Fields.DialogueText: All right, I think you're taking this a little too seriously, Kapitän.
When a warrior's body dies, her spirit lives forever.
My zeal is how I win.
Quite the doomsayer, you are. Now, is that all you have to say?
Good, because I see Nixe forces in need of our attention.
You don't need to go out of your way to fight enemies that don't encroach upon us.
Maybe I don't need to. But I want to.
@BATTLE
Status report.
The ship isn't running as smoothly as usual.
What?
Is anything wrong? Have we sustained damage?
No, nothing like that. We're just not at optimum efficiency.
That means... it's Uzi, right?
Yes. Something must be wrong with the Schiffsdame.
Well, that's the only rational explanation I can think of, anyway.
Where is she? I'll check on her.
*ALARM*
You'll have to wait for that.
Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Knock knock.
It's you.
Okay, you're a mess. Are you hurt?
Mir geht es gut. I can't be broken down.
Are... are you sure?
I can tough through anything, Kappi.

Fields.MenuText: I'll trust your judgment.
I can't believe that.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you calling me weak?
I'd like you to accompany me to the medical bay, please.
Is there a point? I'm not human, you know.
I'm well aware of how special you are. Just do as I say.
Kapitän...
Yes, Uzi?
Will you sit with me for a while?
We'll go to sick bay later. For now, we'll just sit.
Or maybe I shouldn't?

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure about that?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I am!
Danke, Kapitän.
Euthie, weren't you supposed to be resting?
We have enemy forces coming up on us fast from the north.
You sure? I haven't heard the--
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
We've been having too many encounters lately.
Speaking of which... U-37?
Ja, Kapitän.
You're supposed to be resting, but we've been fighting back to back engagements.
The bridge is where I belong.
You don't need to take everything on yourself.
I put my all into protecting my crew. And protecting you too, Kap.
I know. But that doesn't mean you have to work yourself to death.
But, Kappi...
U-37! I order you to return to your quarters, immediately!
Jawohl.
Would you like to play some cards with me?
... Fine, a few rounds. But after that, you are getting some shut-eye.
Okay. Let's go.
No matter how I'm feeling, my place is here on the bridge.
Nein! I'm not!

Fields.MenuText: You need more rest.
Guess you must be feeling better. Good!
You're one of those people who just disagrees with everything.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh.
You think you're pretty clever, don't you?
There they are! Get ready to raid the Morganas!
@BATTLE
Uzi, you look terrible. What's wrong?
I'm just tired.
I know you told me this would happen, but I can't help but work.
Fighting is what I do. The only thing I can do, really. And if I'm not doing my job, then what's the point of me being here, at all?
Uzi...

Fields.MenuText: You're more than just the job you do.
We all need time to recuperate, U-37. Without rest, we can't perform our jobs well.
You wouldn't be having these thoughts if you got more sleep.

Fields.DialogueText: You think so? Are you sure about that?
I suppose that's true.
... You may have a point there.
I'm escorting you back to your room, now. I will sit in front of your door until I'm sure you've fallen asleep. Understand?
Ja.
And, U-37?
Mm?
You're so much more than just someone we keep around to fight for and protect us.
You're a multi-faceted person, and I have no doubt you can accomplish whatever you set your mind to.
Danke, Kapitän.
Kapitän...
This is uncommon. You went out of your way to see me?
Ja. I wanted to talk to you...
It sounds serious.
Nein! Well, maybe. Nothing dire. Just...
What is it?
I just... wanted you to know you're important to me.
I can feel it, like a warmth and a desire to protect you washes over me.
And the thing is, I don't really understand it.
It must be the reason I chose you, but... what is it, exactly? Can you help me? Please?
What are you to me, Kapitän? Whatever it is, I leave in your hands.

Fields.MenuText: I'm your leader and comrade. We share an irreplaceable bond of respect and friendship.
I'm your partner. For as long as you allow me, I'll be by your side.

Fields.DialogueText: I see, Kapitän. I pledge my loyalty to you.
I'm happy to hear that, Kapitän.
Euthie, let's relax today.
Kapitän?
We don't need to fight anything. Let's just enjoy the weather and the water for a little while.
Ja, Kapitän. I think that would do us both a lot of good.
